partners as needed to ensure the consistency of day-to-day workflows.Partner with Production Planning on the implementation of project management tooling and workflow executionPartner closely with Producers and Creatives to ensure seamless execution of projects from end-to-end.Optimize existing workflows and develop new, scalable ones to ensure the production of high-quality creative at the appropriate velocityCommunicate learnings to other regions in order to improve existing operationsThink regionally first, while understanding and upholding global best practicesOur Ideal Candidate Would Exhibit The FollowingRegional expertise and experience working in the marketUnderstanding of regional needs and nuances.Familiarity with regional vendors and agencies in the post-production spaceExtensive production experience across AV, Design, and Creative workflows.Strong project management background managing high asset volume projectsStrong operational skills, specifically when running day-to-day workflows, allocating talent, and overseeing production pipelinesAbility to work both independently and collaboratively with cross-functional partners depending on the needs of a project and in a fast-paced environment.Strong ability to communicate complex workflows or concepts in a simplified mannerAbility to forecast budget, needs and workload across multiple production teamsExperience working and communicating with creatives ie. Editors, designers, motion graphics artists, etcExpert knowledge in post-production scheduling and budgeting software.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
MANAGER, MARKETING PLANNING - APAC
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 233 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.We offer great TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members of all ages and tastes around the world. As we grow our business and teams, we seek talent from a wide range of backgrounds that reflect the global nature of our members. It takes diversity of thought, culture, background, and perspective to create a truly global business.The Netflix culture is unique and attracts individuals who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and intellectual curiosity. Read our culture memo to learn what it’s like working for Netflix. To excel in this environment, you must be independently minded, have impeccable creative taste, and a strong instinct for stories that will get consumers talking about Netflix and our shows more passionately and frequently than ever before.It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix. The Asia region is a critical piece of our international business and an area of rapid growth. People are discovering Netflix every day across Asia, and we want our content to be relevant and irresistible. Finding the perfect strategic and creative mix of entertainment, brand messaging and product experience is key to unlocking waves of new consumers for us in Asia. We are also excited to see our content from Asia traveling more and more, and reaching and delighting audiences around the world.At Netflix, Marketing’s core purpose is to maximize the impact of our content, product and brand so that everyone, everywhere wants to watch Netflix. The Marketing Planning team helps achieve that purpose as a global idea and strategic planning partner, connecting across markets and regions to maximize the impact of our title campaigns and initiatives for audiences around the world.As an integral part of the APAC marketing team, this role will be responsible for understanding Content Strategy and leading Campaign Management for titles that travel and are promoted in multiple markets. Starting with analyzing and understanding which series and films will grow the business in the APAC region, the job will focus largely on supporting the strategy and creative campaign development for global titles in APAC markets, and in some cases for APAC titles that are being promoted outside of home territory. This entails providing strategic insights on title and campaign opportunities, and collaborating with regional partners such as marketing, social, PR, partner marketing, consumer products, and content planning & analysis. The ideal candidate should have a passion for content and the opportunity for its reach to audiences around the world, and be able to work with a variety of stakeholders in APAC and marketing teams in other regions.Key ResponsibilitiesBuild and maintain strong working relationships with key Marketing stakeholders in markets across APAC, UCAN, EMEA, and LATAM, as well as with cross-functional Marcomms partners throughout APAC marketsBe knowledgeable about APAC markets and represent regional priorities and POV in global forumsWork closely with Content and x-functional marketing partners to assess the slate with relevant data inputs and identify title and campaign opportunities that will have impact in APAC and other regional markets.Serve as the point of contact for key global content priorities, socializing titles and initiatives with APAC markets, and identifying opportunities for the campaigns to travel and have business impactIn partnership with home territory leads in other regions, contribute to the strategic development of priority import campaigns, from upstream planning to rollout, ensuring that campaigns are best set up for success to drive impact in APAC markets.Work closely with Marketing teams to define the campaign marketing strategies that resonate with global audiences outside of the home territory – eg. via culturally applicable positioning, early brief and roadmap development, campaign deployment timelines etc.Operating as an APAC campaign planning lead, ensure guidance and alignment on campaign strategy, creatively excellent ideas, global and regional tactics, and rollout across multiple marketsProvide APAC regional IQ insights to cross functional teams in other regions. (e.g cultural behavioral, trends, learnings, title assessments)Lead select global and regional initiatives as APAC marketing representative, ie multi-title campaigns, tooling developments, and other business priorities.The Ideal Candidate Is/Has…Minimum 7 years of experience directly collaborating with Marketing teams, demonstrating a deep understanding of marketing strategy.Someone who exemplifies the Netflix culture and valuesA natural problem-solver who can work through challenges and navigate comfortably in ambiguityAn excellent communicator, a creative partner and strategic thinker who can contribute to early decision-making on campaigns in partnership with Content, MarComms, and other cross-functional and regional partnersSelfless and collaborative, and naturally willing to go beyond roles and titles to get great work done.A track record of successful cross-functional work and someone who can distill insights and information and lead deftly across the many aspects of campaign developmentA collaborative spirit who possesses a strong creative and strategic sensibility and who can expertly build trust and partnership, influence key stakeholders, and foster deep relationships across the businessAbility to thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and demonstrate strong judgment and a solution-driven mindset. Multi-tasker, but with clear time management and prioritization skillsA deep curiosity about our global business and an ability to quickly build global IQ and an understanding of regional and cultural nuances that inform our strategies and campaign developmentPassionate about TV and film content, with some knowledge of the entertainment landscape and industry trends in APAC and the desire to bring our content to audiences in APAC and around the world.Experienced in working in Asia and with other international markets.Fluent in English.We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.

job_title: SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER - GX CLIENT ECOSYSTEM
description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER - GX CLIENT ECOSYSTEM
OverviewJoin Netflix's revolution in entertainment as part of our Growth Experiences Client Ecosystem (GXCE) team. We're pioneering the future of member experiences, and we want you on board. The GXCE team is a cornerstone in our growth engineering strategy, empowering rapid innovation and adaptivity in customer acquisition, scalable commerce, and revenue growth. Our formula for success is straightforward: we expedite growth experiments and product feature launches while reducing cognitive load and fostering autonomy by building an ecosystem of client frameworks and tools across Web, Mobile, and TV platforms, promoting a learning culture, and innovating based on collaborative relationships.Our Long-term Goals Are ToProvide and maintain a paved path that fulfills our purpose and mission.Integrate best practices and standards into our paved path.Promote effective partnerships and collaborations across Web, Mobile, and TV platforms.Become customer advocates – fostering a feedback-rich environment, acting as proxies for complex services, providing comprehensive education, training materials, and documentation, and staying updated with technological advancements to anticipate customer needs.We Evaluate Our Success ThroughDeveloper experience and satisfaction.Our ability to meet and exceed customer expectations.The velocity, volume, and efficiency of experimentation and productization.Our ability to reduce technical debt and optimize engineering practices.Why We Want YouAs we focus on implementing our centralized design system on our Web platform and experiment with Server-Driven UI (SDUI) using GraphQL on the Web, TV, and Mobile, we're looking for an experienced software engineer, ideally with proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, design systems, and SDUI. You'll work with our team to expedite critical projects that will catalyze innovation and drive growth experiments and product launches. Does this sound exciting to you?We value thoughtful engineers who lead with passion, resilience, a positive attitude, and a high degree of empathy. The following expectations are how we measure success for engineers joining the team. However, please note that we do not expect applicants to 100% meet our expectations as a prerequisite for an interview. Any gaps should be treated as growth opportunities once hired.ExpectationsUse your expertise and experience to identify and solve complex problems by driving new or improving existing solutions that positively impact the team’s scope of work.Deliver team-level architecture and project impact, solve problems by leading projects for a few adjacent peers, and drive larger cross-functional projects.Improve efficiency, perform strategic migrations, deprecate or decommission systems, reduce complexity, and selflessly avoid local simplifications that export complexity to other teams.Own decisions regarding component, feature, or system-level quality, reliability, efficiency, and performance, balancing investments in each area.Demonstrate good judgment by applying engineering best practices (e.g., peer reviews, metrics, architecture design, documentation, farming for dissent, collecting input from the team and stakeholders, and weighing tradeoffs).Proactively describe complex technical issues and their impact (within your scope) to stakeholdersEager for opportunities to learn, grow, lead by influence, develop, and mentor others.Understand the importance of gathering feedback, driving alignment, and finding the right balance between trade-offs.Effectively collaborate cross-functionally (e.g., sharing/receiving cross-team feedback, navigating dissent on their approach) on a project-level basis.Embody, contribute to, and shape the Netflix culture while holding colleagues to the same standard.Create environments where people of different backgrounds and experiences feel valued and encouraged to contribute their talents and perspectives.Skills & QualificationsBachelor's degree in a STEM-related field or equivalent computer science fundamentals.5+ years of professional experience designing, building, and shipping software.Strong proficiency in JavaScript & TypeScript.Experience with API development and consumption.Ability to design, architect, debug, test, and create well-documented code.Excellent communication skills.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.Familiarity with UI design systems and SDUI methodology.Hands-on experience with GraphQL using Apollo or similar, Redux, or modern React development using Hooks.Nice to HaveKnowledge of design and architectural patterns.Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks.Experience with app performance and health metrics (e.g., Web Vitals)Experience with or is interested in Mobile development.At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and assess your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically between $300,000 - $900,000. This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which aligns with our compensation philosophy.We operate under a flexible hybrid work policy, making this role remote-friendly. We encourage remote teammates to visit the office at a rhythm that suits them and the team. Netflix is a proud equal-opportunity employer. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We understand that diversity of thought and background makes our team stronger.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SENIOR ENGINEER - UNITY, SPRY FOX
About Our TeamOur motto is, “Make the world a better place”; and we try to do this through the games we make. Invention is part of our DNA at Spry Fox. Whether it’s by designing MMOs that encourage the development of friendships and discourage toxicity, or by designing unique puzzle games that promote English language learning; we’re always asking ourselves “How does this game improve your life?”Spry Fox strives to be a studio that is a pleasure to work for, an important but not dominating part of your life, and recognizes crunch is a negative, counter-productive industry practice — something to be learned from and avoided in the future. We want you to have friends, family, hobbies, and a life outside of work. We want you to love your colleagues and know that they support you 100%. We want you to be proud of what you do and how you do it.For 10+ years, we’ve been fully remote with Foxes scattered all over the world. To make that work well, we all are online and communicative from 9am to 1pm PST to ensure that we have enough overlapping work hours with our team; otherwise, our schedules are flexible and fully under our individual control!Now that we’re a part of Netflix, we can do what we love with more support and without having to worry about how to monetize! We’ve always been focused on making thoughtful, original games… now more than ever.About The JobSpry Fox is looking for a Senior Software Engineer experienced with working in Unity to help us develop the sequel to our hit life sim game, Cozy Grove!Requirements7+ years of professional game development experience Experience shipping at least one commercial game in the Unity engineAdvanced programming skills in C# with the ability to effectively write and evaluate code that optimizes performance and the stability of our gameExperience supporting a live service game titleiOS and Android mobile development experienceAbility to coordinate and build effective partnerships within the engineering team and other development verticalsAbility to work autonomously and influence teams through proactive leadership, and effective communication.Desire to make the world a better place through games!NICE TO HAVEHave any backend (i.e. multiplayer/server) development experience)Have interests outside of game developmentHave shipped several games in your professional careerAt Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $150,000 - 200,000This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
COMMUNICATIONS MANAGER - UK (12M FTC)
It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally.Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.Do you live and breathe entertainment? Do you want to help tell the story of Netflix in the UK? If this resonates, then it could be the job for you!The OpportunityWe are looking for a communications expert to effectively articulate the company's goals. This individual will help build and protect the Netflix brand and reputation in the UK.Based in our London office our ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker, strong communicator, and a relationship builder - who can be a trusted partner and adviser to teams across multiple disciplines.This role will be responsible for executing Netflix’s corporate storytelling and for bringing the Netflix brand to life. This role has strong cross functional interaction with the broader team and thinks about all mediums of communications. This role has a high level of visibility and impact within the business.The Comms Manager will possess 5 years of experience in media, corporate or agency settings and have a background in the entertainment and/or media sector. The successful individual will be used to working in a fast-paced environment that requires agility, selflessness and the ability to manage multiple things at once.You WillHave a background in culture, tech, entertainment or media sector;Be creative, plugged into popular culture with the ability to use our key events and tentpole moments to generate conversation, excitement and emotional connection around the Netflix brand.Have in-depth experience of the UK media landscapes, have - or be capable of - quickly establishing trusted relationships with business, media and technology sector media, news media and entertainment trade press, and a deep understanding of the nuances of newsrooms;Be familiar with, and enthusiastically curious about, the entertainment sector, technology, innovation and media;Have excellent judgment as well as very strong writing and clear communications skills; Have a global mindset, ideally with experience of working in multiple countries and/or in multicultural environments;Be able to work cross-functionally and build relationships inside and outside the organisation; possess strong project management skillsLead comms around our festivals, partnerships and live events.Provide communications support to the Country Leadership Team and support the Senior Comms manager on all UK internal comms.Be capable and confident to serve as a company spokesperson and have strong business acumen;The role may require periodic travel to other European and international locations.The Netflix culture attracts individuals who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion and curiosity. Read our culture memo. If it resonates for you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SOFTWARE ENGINEER 4 - TV UI
The TeamAt Netflix, our mission is to Entertain the World. Over 230 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but much of our growth still lies ahead.Our team is part of an organization that is responsible for driving the growth of Netflix’s subscriber base. Our work helps users discover Netflix, sign up for Netflix, and maintain their Netflix service. We measure our team's success in the company's quarterly revenue.Our team sits at the heart of all growth initiatives and at the intersection of product development and platform innovation. We find satisfaction in pioneering product features on emerging technologies and establishing code patterns for the entire organization. We take pride in owning all productized experiences in the growth space by consistently looking for opportunities to raise product quality and pay down tech debt.The RoleWe are a cross-platform UI Engineering team that develops products on iOS, Android, and Web, and we are currently expanding our TV engineering squad.Here are some examples of TV projects that you will have a chance to work on: Implementing Server-Driven UI principles in our TV products Launching a cutting-edge messaging system on our TV platform Balancing automation test pyramid to increase confidence in our product releases Upgrading our string translation service Deprecating our products on legacy TV devicesWe believe in creating opportunities beyond roles and across team lines, and the breadth of scope in the team is full of opportunities to explore and grow.What Sets You ApartWe value aptitude over experience, and here are some key points that will make you successful on our team: Skilled in Javascript - almost all our code is written in TypeScript and React Incredibly selfless and willing to “Pick up the Trash”, a metaphor for taking care of problems, small and large, and never thinking “that’s someone else’s job.” Curious about technology and product experiences, and motivated to understand how they intertwine Exhibits exceptional grit and persistence when it comes to solving difficult technical problems Displays a strong sense of independence, bias towards action, and inclination for collaboration Treats high code quality as a core valueWhat’s Different About Us Big impact: Opportunity to impact products that hundreds of millions of customers use every single day Growth: Expanding your skillset into deeper layers of the stack or trying your hand at different UI platforms Ownership: We value context over control, empowering you to take ownership of your projects and make informed decisions Stunning colleagues: Work with and learn from our amazing talent on every project Inclusive: We embrace different backgrounds, perspectives, and styles because it helps us make better decisions Distinctive culture: we live by our values, learn more about our unique cultureAt Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $100,000 - $700,000This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here .
linkedin_job_description: The TeamAt Netflix, our mission is to Entertain the World. Over 230 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but much of our growth still lies ahead.Our team is part of an organization that is responsible for driving the growth of Netflix’s subscriber base. Our work helps users discover Netflix, sign up for Netflix, and maintain their Netflix service. We measure our team's success in the company's quarterly revenue.Our team sits at the heart of all growth initiatives and at the intersection of product development and platform innovation. We find satisfaction in pioneering product features on emerging technologies and establishing code patterns for the entire organization. job_title: ACCOUNTS PAYABLE INVOICE PROCESSING SPECIALIST (JAPANESE SPEAKING)
description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
ACCOUNTS PAYABLE INVOICE PROCESSING SPECIALIST (JAPANESE SPEAKING)
As Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth. We are looking for an Accounts Payable (AP) professional to support our International Supplier Invoice operations. This newly created position is due to the continued growth of the business , and will be based in our Philippines office and report into the Accounts Payable Manager based in Singapore. This position will interact with the AP team across our global offices and will require a flexible worker for the role.The perfect candidate for this role will be very detail oriented, able to analyze a large volume of transactions with high accuracy, have excellent communication skills, be capable of multitasking and taking the initiative to drive process change and improvements.The Accounts Payable Specialist (AP Specialist) is responsible for the day-to-day Accounts Payable activities including:Assist with processing high volumes PO and Non-PO invoices in multiple languages and currenciesManual invoice processing in Workday ERP Review invoices to ensure proper coding and compliance with company policies, controls and procedures.Identify Invoice and PO discrepancies and assigning the appropriate categorization and reporting for resolution in Workday ERP and Invoice/Inquiry ticketing systemIdentify process improvements and automation opportunities Identify and report opportunities for process and policies improvementsValidation of invoices captured with Workday Optical Character Recognition (OCR) solution.Review and process invoices for accuracy in account coding and tax treatment.Ability to identify process gaps and improvement opportunities across the Accounts Payable process.Review, analyze, and respond to internal and external supplier inquiries Liaison for AP and internal business partners in maintaining relationships with suppliers and service providersSupport audit tasks for tax/finance teams as assignedPerform other duties and ad hoc tasks contributing to the organization’s goalsSkills RequiredAble to work with high volume of transactions in a fast-paced environment Able to maintain a high level of accuracy in preparing and entering financial informationCustomer Service oriented person who focuses on quality communication and attention to detailExcellent written and verbal communication skillsProficient in Excel and ERP systems (Workday experience a plus)Highly motivated with the ability to work independently Forward looking thinker who can articulate the need for and contribute to process improvements ideas Works with a sense of urgency and sensitivity to last-minute highly critical business requestsUses good judgment and knows when to make a decision and when to escalateExemplifies the Netflix CultureUnderstanding of SOX compliance rules and guidelinesFluent in English and KoreanEducation And ExperienceAccounting or Finance background5+ years of relevant experienceDegree in a relevant field of studyExperience at a Global Company a plusKnowledge of cloud related ERP systems a plusExperience with a ticketing tool or system a plusWe are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
EMPLOYEE SERVICES WORKDAY ASSOCIATE
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 236 million paid memberships in over 234 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.This position is part of the HR Shared Services team, operating in the role as the main point of contact for all HR inquiries from initial request through fulfillment, and will partner with our local and regional talent teams to identify solutions and resolve employee issues in a timely fashion (focused on Workday transactions and data input & accuracy). You will be expected to be independent and proactive, with a customer service mindset and great stakeholder management skills.ResponsibilitiesEnsure the accuracy of employee data through the management of employee systems and processesYou will assist with programs that reach all employees, ensuring they run smoothly, so employees can focus on doing the best work of their lives.You will have the opportunity to learn new tools and techniques that can then be applied to simplify, optimize and automate work across our Talent organizationHelp create, author and manage our HR knowledge base for our employeesAssist with analyzing, intaking and operationalizing new employee services (from pre-hire to offboarding)Performs system and testing audits as requested for data accuracy, integrity, and functionality; analyzes and document results and discrepanciesQualificationsDemonstrated proficiency with Workday HCM toolDemonstrated proficiency in Mass Uploads (EIB).Demonstrated project management, communication, and customer service skills.Strong analytical skills, including intermediate to advanced proficiency in sheets/excel.Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.Ability to problem solve by using rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems.A degree in HR, Business, IT, or a related field is preferred but not required.Experience in Workday Data Analyst, HR discipline or as a HR Generalist (A plus!).Experience with Zendesk ticket system (A plus!).

job_title: SR. MANAGER MARKETING PARTNERSHIPS - BENELUX FTC
description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SR. MANAGER MARKETING PARTNERSHIPS - BENELUX FTC
It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key to growth is our ability to work well with global partners across verticals. As we move beyond 200 million members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, we are looking for talented individuals to drive great creative outcomes for our partnerships.Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture.Our partners include all the top Telecommunications (e.g. KPN, Ziggo, Telenet, Proximus) and Consumer Electronics brands (e.g. Samsung, Google) in the region. Our consumers often discover and subscribe to the Netflix service through our partners and watch the Netflix content on their product. We are always seeking to create ways to support and drive conversations about our titles and brand locally working with partners to develop common storytelling in cutting edge, creative ways.We are therefore looking for a talented marketing professional who enjoys managing and growing relationships with partners and is comfortable owning the full life cycle of partner marketing projects from end-to-end creative strategy to execution. The successful candidate will have deep experience building and implementing creative strategy as well as elevating creative output from brief to execution.The successful candidate will drive our efforts in the Benelux region (Netherlands and Belgium), that will help both our partners and Netflix business goals. The Senior Marketing Manager Partnerships Benelux will be based in Amsterdam and be part of the EMEA Partner Marketing team, reporting into the Benelux.This is a full-time fixed term contract position located in Amsterdam for maternity cover. The RoleAs a key point of contact for marketing questions regarding partnerships, the candidate will provide a critical link between business development, product, content and marketing teams to achieve business goals in the region. To do so the successful candidate will frequently travel in the region and work closely with several stakeholders internally and externally. As partner-facing strategists and gatekeepers of the Netflix brand, this role will ultimately be responsible for setting the creative strategy, ensuring business objectives are met, and extending our content story across a wide array of partner marketing efforts.Duties & ResponsibilitiesOwn the marketing relationship with our partners across The Netherlands and Belgium (i.e.: KPN, Ziggo, T-mobile, Proximus, Telenet, Samsung, Google etc.) including creating opportunities with their C-Level.Nurture existing partnerships and launch new ones to generate incremental subscriptions for Netflix by taking ownership of the day-to-day sales/marketing campaigns.Work closely cross functionally with Marketing, Product, Business Development, Content Services, Public Relations, and Brand/Editorial teams to identify opportunities to bring Netflix in the core of our partners marketing campaign and across their channels.Activate marketing collaboration by developing and launching creative partner marketing programs that bring the Netflix content in the core of successful campaigns for our partners.Drive Trade Marketing Strategy for the region and manage Trade Marketing Manager.Collaborate with the partner marketing partnerships creative team in London to create campaigns speaking to consumers in unique and unexpected ways and elevate the Netflix brand.Introduce new partners and their agencies to the Netflix brand and offering creative guidance and expertise to elevate creative output and inventive storytelling.Own the responsibility for ensuring relevant Netflix brand positioning and representation / usage of Netflix and studio content in partner campaigns; owning partner creative feedback loop and consumer-facing output.Bring market insights and communication hubs to support the overall Netflix marketing strategy for the Benelux region and prioritize campaigns that complete the title marketing efforts.Define corrective actions to improve effectiveness and results.Qualifications - The Successful CandidateWill thrive in our Culture.Has significant experience with several years in similar (partner) marketing roles. Working in or with the Entertainment/Content industry is essential (i.e. digital distributor, telecommunication, movie studio, gaming, music industry, etc).Has an impeccable track record of cultivating relationships and a deep level of respect with top brand and agency marketers and management.Has great communication and interpersonal skills: Fluency in English and Dutch is required, French would be a bonus.Is passionate about Entertainment, Design, Pop culture, Technology, Arts, and Advertising. Is a creative and story-teller at heart, with an incredible eye for great ideas and compelling campaign dynamics, with a finger on the pulse of culture.Is business-savvy, has a growth mindset and combines data with judgment to make well-informed decisions.Is capable of managing multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously without the support of a large team, working both independently and in close collaboration with a wide variety of stakeholders.Has experience in developing creative ideas to different media formats and audiences to solve business problems and engage consumers.Can organize, clarify and communicate complex ideas quickly, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet, and quickly responds to inquiries and questions.Is someone committed to creating more inclusive spaces in advertising, passionate about fostering diversity within their primary network of partners, agencies, production companies etc.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SENIOR MANAGER, ADS MEASUREMENT UK
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners, and to drive advertising revenue. The measurement team is responsible for building audience insights and measurement solutions from the ground up, partnering closely with data science, consumer insights, product and sales to understand core customer needs and develop both foundational and innovative solutions.In This Role, You WillWork closely with the broader ads measurement team, both within EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) and globally, product and data engineering to prioritise and implement the measurement roadmap across the UK market in collaboration with the Director of Ads Measurement Strategy, EMEA.Partner with Ads Marketing and Sales to deliver data and insights to our advertising clients and agencies with key narratives around the Netflix audience and serviceEngage with measurement partners in ensuring that Netflix is accurately represented in industry measurement toolsProvide marketplace positioning and storytelling customized for verticals and clientsAssist in developing full-funnel measurement solutions that enable advertisers to understand the value and efficacy of their Netflix campaignsInform on opportunities for alternative currencies, targeting and/or measurement productsDeliver thought leadership by deeply understanding consumer perception, attitudes and behaviors related to both content and ads on Netflix and the competitive landscapeAbout You10+ years in media measurement at a TV, streaming or digital companyDual TV/Video and digital experience is a plusSelf starter with expertise in managing large-scale, complex projectsStrong knowledge of the advertising landscape, across all kinds of media channels and methods of buyingLoves to get into the weeds and can see the big pictureOpen to innovating, challenging assumptions and implementing better approachesKnowledge of quantitative and qualitative methodologiesUnderstanding of the consumer’s voice and how to turn that into actionable insightsA strong business partner to other cross functional teams and a leader who can prioritize multiple projectsCollaborates effectively and embraces differing perspectives and experiences to make better decisionsExperienced and at ease with diverse cultures and working in international environments

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SUCCESS MANAGER - APAC
It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring new stories to over 230+ million people in over 190 countries worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key growth factor is our ability to empower Netflix personnel to utilize in-house-built cutting-edge technology that maximizes studio/production efficiencies to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture.The Team The Content & Business Product Success team uniquely sits between the teams developing the software products for Netflix Studio and the Studio employees & external partners who utilize these products to get their work done. We are a Success Team that actively engages with cross-functional teams from both organizations on a daily basis to help drive change management, lead user education, assist with go-to-market launch campaigns, positively influence product adoption, and partner in closing feedback loops to both end user stakeholders and the Product teams. Our main goal is to empower all users (internal & external) of Netflix technology to do their jobs faster, easier, and smarter while gaining value toward their business goals. What we learn from doing this turns into feedback shared with the product teams that influences product development. If you are an early tech adopter and enjoy creating new pathways to help others do their best work and drive change/innovation, this is the space for you.The RoleThe Customer (User/Client) Success Manager is responsible for developing education strategy and implementation of blended and scalable learning solutions for Netflix-built apps. CSM’s will also foster relationships with our application user groups; define, evangelize, and manage our product feedback loop; and provide user health insights to our Product partners. This role requires global thinking and proactive regional partnership to reach internal and external users around the world. This person must be passionate about helping users gain value out of software and be able to understand nuanced workflows across several products that are connected in an ecosystem.ResponsibilitiesFacilitate instructor-led training sessions for a portfolio of products.Act as the customer/user advocate (voice of the customer) for the Product organization; involves partnership with active stakeholder groups, and in some cases direct users, as well as partner insights teams like Support, Studio Insights, etcThe informed captain for driving APAC user success with a portfolio of products, which involves multiple simultaneous workstreams.Develop an education strategy that’s integrated with a product’s larger go-to-market strategy, creating tailored and scalable blended learning experiences for the product’s entire audience.Tailor the communications strategy to APAC users for new feature releases as necessary, ensuring that teams are aware of the impact on their workflows.Think and partner with CBP Success teammates to drive product engagement, adoption, and value to users.Establish clear and consistent pathways for driving impact that results in gaining user (internal and external) value from the product and communication of feedback therein to product development teams.Contribute to the knowledge base of all training materials for a domain of products.Build strong relationships and trust with business partners, SMEs, and users to effectively advocate with and on behalf of them to product development teams.Gather unstructured user feedback and communicate that feedback in partnership with Support and Insights teams to share holistic insights where it’s most impactful to inform product development.Engage with data to drive storytelling on behalf of users that reports customer/user health to Product and Business stakeholders and contributes to Product decisions.The Ideal CandidateWill thrive in our Culture;Fluent in Japanese and English.Has 3 -5 years of Customer Success experience.Flexibility amid an ever-changing and growing environment and ability to create clarity amid ambiguity.Is willing and able to run lean with a DIY mentality that inspires others around them to do the same.Aptitude for analyzing data, finding the story within, and using it to drive decisions.Has a strong understanding of studio/production workflows and the streaming entertainment industry in general.Ability to implement blended learning programs (set goals, create materials, gather data, measure effectiveness)Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including an affinity for simplifying complex workflows and motivating users to engage with new technologies.Communicates well and leads comfortably in multicultural, large and small group settings.Is passionate about leaning into new ideas/technology and driving change management by helping others overcome legacy thinking.Has experience with G Suite and is comfortable learning & using a set of productivity and CRM tooling.Does this sound interesting but overwhelming? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. linkedin_job_description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring new stories to over 230+ million people in over 190 countries worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key growth factor is our ability to empower Netflix personnel to utilize in-house-built cutting-edge technology that maximizes studio/production efficiencies to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture.The Team The Content & Business Product Success team uniquely sits between the teams developing the software products for Netflix Studio and the Studio employees & external partners who utilize these products to get their work done. We are a Success Team that actively engages with cross-functional teams from both organizations on a daily basis to help drive change management, lead user education, assist with go-to-market launch campaigns, positively influence product adoption, and partner in closing feedback loops to both end user stakeholders and the Product teams. Our main goal is to empower all users (internal & external) of Netflix technology to do their jobs faster, easier, and smarter while gaining value toward their business goals. What we learn from doing this turns into feedback shared with the product teams that influences product development. If you are an early tech adopter and enjoy creating new pathways to help others do their best work and drive change/innovation, this is the space for you.The RoleThe Customer (User/Client) Success Manager is responsible for developing education strategy and implementation of blended and scalable learning solutions for Netflix-built apps. CSM’s will also foster relationships with our application user groups; define, evangelize, and manage our product feedback loop; and provide user health insights to our Product partners. This role requires global thinking and proactive regional partnership to reach internal and external users around the world. This person must be passionate about helping users gain value out of software and be able to understand nuanced workflows across several products that are connected in an ecosystem.ResponsibilitiesFacilitate instructor-led training sessions for a portfolio of products.Act as the customer/user advocate (voice of the customer) for the Product organization; involves partnership with active stakeholder groups, and in some cases direct users, as well as partner insights teams like Support, Studio Insights, etcThe informed captain for driving APAC user success with a portfolio of products, which involves multiple simultaneous workstreams.Develop an education strategy that’s integrated with a product’s larger go-to-market strategy, creating tailored and scalable blended learning experiences for the product’s entire audience.Tailor the communications strategy to APAC users for new feature releases as necessary, ensuring that teams are aware of the impact on their workflows.Think and partner with CBP Success teammates to drive product engagement, adoption, and value to users.Establish clear and consistent pathways for driving impact that results in gaining user (internal and external) value from the product and communication of feedback therein to product development teams.Contribute to the knowledge base of all training materials for a domain of products.Build strong relationships and trust with business partners, SMEs, and users to effectively advocate with and on behalf of them to product development teams.Gather unstructured user feedback and communicate that feedback in partnership with Support and Insights teams to share holistic insights where it’s most impactful to inform product development.Engage with data to drive storytelling on behalf of users that reports customer/user health to Product and Business stakeholders and contributes to Product decisions.The Ideal CandidateWill thrive in our Culture;Fluent in Japanese and English.Has 3 -5 years of Customer Success experience.Flexibility amid an ever-changing and growing environment and ability to create clarity amid ambiguity.Is willing and able to run lean with a DIY mentality that inspires others around them to do the same.Aptitude for analyzing data, finding the story within, and using it to drive decisions.Has a strong understanding of studio/production workflows and the streaming entertainment industry in general.Ability to implement blended learning programs (set goals, create materials, gather data, measure effectiveness)Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including an affinity for simplifying complex workflows and motivating users to engage with new technologies.Communicates well and leads comfortably in multicultural, large and small group settings.Is passionate about leaning into new ideas/technology and driving change management by helping others overcome legacy thinking.Has experience with G Suite and is comfortable learning & using a set of productivity and CRM tooling.Does this sound interesting but overwhelming? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
MANAGER, FILM & SERIES MARKETING - JAPAN
Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.We’re looking for an innovative, self-starter to fill the role of Manager, Film & Series Marketing, Japan and create breakthrough ideas that market our titles and create a lasting brand story for local members. From blockbusters like The Naked Director, First Love, and Alice in Borderland to our upcoming slate of distinctive, local Netflix originals, this is an opportunity to lead the development, launch and execution of 360 title campaigns that pierce the cultural zeitgeist and drive global conversation.Our ideal candidate is strategic, solution-oriented and highly passionate about storytelling, as this person will serve as the strategist and creative lead for title campaigns.We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit.ResponsibilitiesDevelop, lead and execute unique and conversational title campaigns which place Netflix in the middle of cultural zeitgeist.Serve as creative lead for these campaigns from print/OOH, trailers/AV/Social, events/activations to non-traditional headline-grabbing creative.Align with the global branding strategy to establish Netflix brand image within the Japanese market via campaign activities.Work alongside other marketing functions (Social Marketing, Partner Marketing) to build impactful brand campaigns that demonstrate our values and ingrain us in Japanese culturePartner with and act as the main point of contact for local creative and media agencies to bring campaign creative to life.Partner with and act as the main point of contact for marketing communications with local talent agencies and production companies to share our campaign strategies Work with and serve as the liaison between internal cross-functional teams (such as Content, Publicity, Product etc.), ensuring that all aspects of a title campaign are cohesive across all lines of business.Be a cultural ambassador to help Netflix better understand the needs and shifting cultural landscape of JapanContinue to innovate and push to think of the best media strategies for NetflixQualificationsA seasoned creative exec/marketer with ~8 years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably at a streamer, network or studio with a background in entertainment or for a global lifestyle brand that intersects with Japanese entertainment and culture (TV, film, gaming, sport)A natural leader, team player and project manager; you are a selfless, collaborative marketing professional who will go beyond your roles to get great work done.Passionate about great stories. You can talk on and on about your favorite shows, genres, and creators you admire for your life.A proven track record of building impactful, world-class creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. We are not only building campaigns, we are transforming our properties into culturally relevant brands.Knowledge and experience in building and executing strategic media strategies.Inherently bold and comfortable with risk-taking.Strong presentation, prioritization and decision making skills.An entrepreneurial mindset. This person should be a proactive self-starter, who is not afraid to get their hands dirty and wear multiple hats.Passionate and curious about all aspects of Netflix the Netflix business at large.Written and Verbal fluency in Japanese language is requiredFluency in English language is preferableWe are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
ENGINEERING MANAGER, CONSOLIDATED LOGGING
As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers that help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. At the core of all this innovation is reliable, high-quality data which fuels progress in the form of new user experiences and personalization.Netflix is looking for a seasoned engineering leader to head the Consolidated Logging team. This team is responsible for the consumer-facing logging infrastructure which enables analysis, experimentation, and personalization across the entire Netflix experience. In this role, you will be responsible for building and leading a team of extraordinary engineers who will partner across the company to build cutting edge improvements to the Netflix product. You will help influence and guide projects from end-to-end: ideation to production.To be successful in this role, you need to be a strong people manager; great at giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others. You also need a strong software engineering background, to be a quick and data-driven learner, to have proven data engineering and system design skills, and the ability to lead large multi-disciplinary, cross-functional teams.ResponsibilitiesRecruiting: You are constantly on the lookout for talent and have a knack for recognizing and attracting top-tier engineers to your team. You understand the importance of building an amazing team that is additive and diverse, and the value it brings to the overall company.Feedback & Development: You will coach and guide employees through their strengths and weaknesses through regular feedback.Contribute to Data Science & Engineering Leadership. You will be expected to participate in leadership conversations and interview for engineering teams across Netflix.Vision: You intuitively understand business and technology and you leverage that to guide a team by providing relevant context and inspiration.Partnership: You will continue to establish strong relationships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix.Skills & CharacteristicsYou are a natural people leader who also demonstrates humility. You care deeply about people, and their success. You invest in your relationships, so that you have an understanding of the whole person and their perspective.You’re not afraid of hard conversations, and are gifted at coaching your colleagues through difficult situations. You are comfortable sharing your perspective on challenging people dynamics.You seek to de-escalate tense situations, and are creative & flexible in finding balance with partners to maximize impact.You are a strong communicator, and self-aware about how others perceive your comments. As someone in a leadership role you aim to be assertive, not passive nor aggressive, in providing input, support, and feedback.You are forward-looking and able to anticipate the investments Netflix should be making to improve efficiency, innovation, and alignment. You identify areas for continuous improvement, and persistently advocate for action to address them.You have an impeccable eye for technical talent, and a history of influencing hiring decisions across organizations. In this role you will be expected to understand how the Data Science & Engineering organization’s broad hiring strategy translates into the needs of our team, and our partners.You’re allergic to micromanagement. You prefer to give context, delegate, and watch amazing people exceed your hopes and expectations.You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines.Preferred RequirementsYou have 10+ years software development experience. You have a mastery of object-oriented design and design patterns, and programming skills.You have 5+ years of engineering team management experience.You have a MS in Computer Science/Engineering, or related field.You have used big data technologies (i.e. Spark/MapReduce/Hadoop, etc.) at one point in your career, and have built web-scale data pipelines.You have used SQL and reporting tools at one point in your career, and are analytically savvy.The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $310,000 - $1,200,000.This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.Two More Things To KnowOur culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at https://jobs.netflix.com/culture.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SALES PARTNER LEAD, UK
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. We are now seeking a Sales Partner Lead to help shape the UK sales strategy for Netflix.As the Sales Partner Lead, you will be responsible for helping lead the development and execution of sales strategy for the UK. You will work closely with the senior level Investment and Account Planning stakeholders at the Agency operating companies within an Agency Holding group.The role will involve a combination of developing business with the senior stakeholders at a given major agency group alongside the building of key client relationships with C-level, VP, and Director contacts within those portfolios. As the Sales Partner Lead, you will be tasked with jointly driving Netflix Advertising opportunities with both key Agency partners and Client leaders.You will be accountable for delivering revenue targets by leveraging Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings. You will work closely with our Measurement Leads to develop the best-in-class measurement solutions to meet our Clients’ needs. The role will also be a focal point for driving the necessary internal developments to ensure our success. Cross-functional collaboration with Ad Product, Marketing, Content, and Partnership Development teams will be crucial.The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the advertising ecosystem in the UK, an established network of relationships, and a track record of delivering revenue growth.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute Agency focused sales for the UK to deliver revenue targets and exceed client expectations.Build and maintain strong relationships with a major Agency Holding group and related Agencies to secure ad partnerships and drive revenue growth.Develop long term relationships with key senior Clients within those portfolios.Partner with Microsoft Partner teams to respond to briefs and grow the business togetherDevelop sales strategies and sales plans for the assigned Account portfolio Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of advertising campaigns.Leverage Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings to drive revenue growth.Monitor market trends, competitor activity and identify opportunities for innovation.We’re Looking ForAt least 10 years of experience in advertising (incl. sales) with a proven track record of delivering revenue growth.Deep understanding of the Media Agencies/Holding Companies in the UK and an established network of relationships at senior level within them.Experience in both TV and digital advertising sales will be a plusA degree of people management experience is preferableStrong analytical (strategic and creative) capabilities and judgment.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross‐functionally.Open to the challenge of starting a new business, comfortable with risk, uncertainty and ambiguity

description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
MANAGER, COMMUNITY - MULTICULTURAL PUBLICITY
It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 233 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.The OpportunityThis Manager of Community on the Multicultural Publicity Team will work across our publicity teams, helping to craft campaigns that drive culturally relevant conversations around the Netflix brand, titles, and talent. The role will help devise and execute tailored, culturally relevant and innovative campaigns that help shape the perception of our Original Films, Series, Kids & Family and Documentary content within multicultural communities.The ideal candidate will have deep entertainment (film, tv, sports, and/or music) experience and strong industry relationships along with a love of great storytelling! They will know how to strategically engage with specific community audiences through publicity, digital, grassroots and event efforts. This is a very hands-on role that requires extensive knowledge of the cultural landscape, a savvy consumer of social media, as well as the ability to be a strong cross-functional partner to multiple teams, including publicity, communications, marketing, editorial & publishing and awards.The role requires a seasoned professional who is results-oriented, as well as a clear and concise communicator. They will have experience in communicating with executives, filmmakers, talent, talent representatives, agencies and production partners. They can anticipate messaging needs, be proactive, and able to meet fast-breaking deadlines. Curiosity, creativity, and the ability to take risks are expected. This person will need to be able to manage a budget, operate at scale and be able to identify efficiencies while also keeping standards high and focusing on impact.The RoleProvide big-picture thinking and leadership to continuously elevate and promote Netflix’s original contentManage strong community and partner relationships with brands, organizations, and community leaders that speak to Latinx as well as Black, Asian American, and LGBTQ communities Develop relationships with Brands, Organizations, Founders, Executive Directors, Community Organizers, Community Engagement and Event Leads, College/School Administrators, etc Identify strategic partnerships with Community organizations and leaders Create a strategic plan to support a title with community partnerships Know what is in the cultural zeitgeist and the ability to identify cultural moments at the intersection of audiences and title workAlign and strategize with Audience Publicists on titles where Community efforts will drive conversationsDevelop budget and resources needed against plan Oversee execution of community plan The Ideal QualificationsIdeally 10 years of progressive experience within marketing, publicity or social; experience leading audience or community engagement initiatives is highly preferredEntertainment experience working in a studio, network, agency, brand or organization (experience within Sports would be a huge added plus!)Proven success engaging communities and building audiences through Community & strategic partnershipsExperience engaging with multicultural audiences and deep knowledge of cultural festivals, conventions and eventsAbility to build strong relationships and work across many internal cross-functional teamsHigh tolerance for change and the capacity to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentRespect and enthusiasm for the Netflix brand, its IP and its cultureEntrepreneurial and highly curious. Experience working within a startup at a larger corporation is a plus.Must be able to prioritize and handle several projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment while adhering to shifting deadlinesAt Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $165,000 - $445,000This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.The OpportunityThis Manager of Community on the Multicultural Publicity Team will work across our publicity teams, helping to craft campaigns that drive culturally relevant conversations around the Netflix brand, titles, and talent. The role will help devise and execute tailored, culturally relevant and innovative campaigns that help shape the perception of our Original Films, Series, Kids & Family and Documentary content within multicultural communities.The ideal candidate will have deep entertainment (film, tv, sports, and/or music) experience and strong industry relationships along with a love of great storytelling! They will know how to strategically engage with specific community audiences through publicity, digital, grassroots and event efforts. This is a very hands-on role that requires extensive knowledge of the cultural landscape, a savvy consumer of social media, as well as the ability to be a strong cross-functional partner to multiple teams, including publicity, communications, marketing, editorial & publishing and awards.The role requires a seasoned professional who is results-oriented, as well as a clear and concise communicator. They will have experience in communicating with executives, filmmakers, talent, talent representatives, agencies and production partners. They can anticipate messaging needs, be proactive, and able to meet fast-breaking deadlines. Curiosity, creativity, and the ability to take risks are expected. This person will need to be able to manage a budget, operate at scale and be able to identify efficiencies while also keeping standards high and focusing on impact.The RoleProvide big-picture thinking and leadership to continuously elevate and promote Netflix’s original contentManage strong community and partner relationships with brands, organizations, and community leaders that speak to Latinx as well as Black, Asian American, and LGBTQ communities Develop relationships with Brands, Organizations, Founders, Executive Directors, Community Organizers, Community Engagement and Event Leads, College/School Administrators, etc Identify strategic partnerships with Community organizations and leaders Create a strategic plan to support a title with community partnerships Know what is in the cultural zeitgeist and the ability to identify cultural moments at the intersection of audiences and title workAlign and strategize with Audience Publicists on titles where Community efforts will drive conversationsDevelop budget and resources needed against plan Oversee execution of community plan The Ideal QualificationsIdeally 10 years of progressive experience within marketing, publicity or social; experience leading audience or community engagement initiatives is highly preferredEntertainment experience working in a studio, network, agency, brand or organization (experience within Sports would be a huge added plus!)Proven success engaging communities and building audiences through Community & strategic partnershipsExperience engaging with multicultural audiences and deep knowledge of cultural festivals, conventions and eventsAbility to build strong relationships and work across many internal cross-functional teamsHigh tolerance for change and the capacity to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentRespect and enthusiasm for the Netflix brand, its IP and its cultureEntrepreneurial and highly curious. Experience working within a startup at a larger corporation is a plus.Must be able to prioritize and handle several projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment while adhering to shifting deadlinesAt Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $165,000 - $445,000This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

job_title: SENIOR QA ANALYST/TEST LEAD - GAMES STUDIO
description:
JOB IMPORTED FROM LINKEDIN 
NETFLIX
SENIOR QA ANALYST/TEST LEAD - GAMES STUDIO
Next Games is a Netflix Game Studio, focusing on creating compelling fans-first interactive experiences by combining the stories of well-known movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. An unwavering focus on fans and fun gameplay is at the core of the studio’s game development, free from the constraints of free-to-play.If working on globally recognised entertainment IPs, or helping develop the next blockbuster game IP; that’ll be available on the world's biggest streaming platform Netflix, sounds like your cup of tea, Next Games can provide that opportunity.As a Senior QA Analyst you have passion for mobile games and eagerness to take on the next big challenge. You will get to help our teams deliver high quality gaming service experiences to the players. In this role, you will be responsible for creating, executing, and maintaining comprehensive testing strategies, ensuring that our mobile games meet and exceed the high-quality standards our partners have come to expect. You will work closely with our design, development, and production teams, focusing on crafting and executing test cases to identify and address issues. You will also set testing priorities for a team of external vendor testers to ensure an excellent gaming experience for our users.Key ResponsibilitiesTake the overall QA responsibility of a large mobile game projectCreate, execute, and maintain test cases to ensure that all objectives are met and that our mobile games function as expected.Track the process of error identification and resolution, and confirm that issues have been effectively addressed.Execute test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates. Participate in product design reviews to provide input on functional requirements, product designs, schedules, or potential problems.Provide feedback and recommendations to developers on software usability, accessibility and functionality.Work closely with production and support teams to swiftly identify and resolve issues.Set priorities and provide direction for a team of external vendor testersSkills And ExperienceProven experience as a QA analyst or similar role in the gaming industry or relevant role (4+ years preferred).Excellent knowledge of quality assurance methodologies and tools.Proven experience in crafting and executing detailed test cases.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Strong analytical and communication skills.Familiarity with mobile platforms (iOS, Android, etc.) and related technologies.Mobile games industry working experience is a plus.Experience with automated testing tools is a plus.
